subject: Career
title: Financial Planning for Career Transitions
description: One-minute skill: Financial Planning for Career Transitions.

hook.text: She wanted to switch careers but had three months of savings. That's a transition without a parachute.

buildup.text: Financial runway determines how much time you can afford to transition, retrain, and find the new role.

discovery.text: Experts recommend 6-12 months of expenses saved before making a major career change.

twist.text: Income doesn't have to go to zero. Part-time work, freelancing, or consulting bridges the gap.

climax.text: Calculate your 'burn rate' â€” monthly expenses minus any income. That's your transition clock.

punchline.text: Freedom to choose requires financial runway. Build it first.

quiz.question: How much savings do experts recommend before a major career transition?
